definitions.definition: Any of various bowed string instruments, often a violin when played in any of various traditional styles, as opposed to classical violin.
definitions.example: When I play it like this, it's a fiddle; when I play it like that, it's a violin.

definitions.definition: A kind of dock (Rumex pulcher) with leaves shaped like the musical instrument.
An adjustment intended to cover up a basic flaw.
definitions.example: That parameter setting is just a fiddle to make the lighting look right.

definitions.definition: On board a ship or boat, a rail or batten around the edge of a table or stove to prevent objects falling off at sea. (Also fiddle rail)
To adjust or manipulate for deception or fraud.
definitions.example: Fred was sacked when the auditors caught him fiddling the books.

definitions.definition: To play traditional tunes on a violin in a non-classical style.
To touch or fidget with something in a restless or nervous way, or tinker with something in an attempt to make minor adjustments or improvements.
